10 Best-Seller Salman Rushdie Books: Explore the Magic of His Fiction

Salman Rushdie is an award-winning novelist and essayist whose work revolves around magical realism, and historical and literary fiction. His books, Midnight’s Children, The Satanic Verses, Haroun, and Sea of Stories have won several awards and recognition by prestigious institutions. This article features a list of the best Salman Rushdie books that will make all bookworms delve into his magic of fiction.

Top Bridgerton books to explore the magic of regency romance

The best-selling Bridgerton book series, available in Kindle, paperback and hardcover editions, invites readers into a captivating world of romance and intrigue. Authored by Julia Quinn, this beloved series follows the lives and romances of the Bridgerton siblings as they navigate the complexities of Regency-era society in London. From the passionate love story of Daphne and Simon in "The Duke and I" to the enthralling tales of Anthony, Benedict, Colin and the rest of the Bridgerton clan, each book immerses readers in a delightful blend of scandal, wit, and undeniable chemistry.

Face the facts, ban fiction, imagination

A campaign proposed by an unknown group suggests making all forms of fiction illegal, citing the danger of being suckered into half-truths. According to the group, even works of the ancient poet, Plato, were controversial among Greek philosophers who wanted to ban poets and their works from their ideal state. In promoting the idea of reality, the group claims that people should toughen up and encounter unpleasant truths, rather than diving into alternative facts.

7 Most Popular Books of Ernest Hemingway

Ernest Hemingway based the characters in his short stories and novels on actual people, including his parents, acquaintances, and fellow authors. He based his settings and stories on real locations and events. Because Hemingway's works reflect his interests and adventures at various stages of his life, ranking his books is difficult. The following lists Ernest Hemingway’s most popular books and well-praised works that add to Hemingway's legacy.
